title: 22 last-minute Valentines Day gifts that will arrive on time
description: Don't worry — they'll arrive in time for the big day.
text: Last-minute Valentine’s Day gifts don’t have to be bad, or impersonal, or something you found in the bargain bit at CVS. Maybe you’ve just been doing a bit of unconscious research this whole time so you could find the absolutely perfect gift this year. (Yeah, that’s it.) If you waited until the last minute to find a gift for your loved one this Valentine’s Day, then rest assured that you still have plenty of options for a thoughtful gift. Thanks in large part to speedy shipping options, monthly subscriptions, and digital gifts galore, this list has been expertly engineered so that your last-minute Valentine’s Day gift may actually be the best Valentine’s Day gift. Need more ideas? Check out our mega list of the best Valentine’s Day gifts, or get specific and peruse gift ideas for your wife, husband, girlfriend, or boyfriend. If you're still stumped trying to shop for that special someone, then we also have a guide to the best gifts under $50. A KindleUnlimited Plan Best when paired with a Kindle For some people, a neverending TBR pile is a point of pride. Gift them thousands of titles at their fingertips with a membership to KindleUnlimited, which can be accessed via the Kindle app on any of the compatible e-readers. (Which is all of them.) Once you sign them up, a code will be sent to your Valentine on the day of your choosing. Sur la Table online cooking classes Best for a cozy date night A cooking class is such a sweet date idea, but it can be challenging to get out of the house (especially if you have kids). Sur la table's online cooking classes solve this problem. Choose from classics like fresh pasta and beef bourguignon or stretch your skills with sushi, macarons, or a two-day croissant workshop. Classes start at $29 per session, regardless of how many people are in your kitchen. An Audible membership Best for good listeners For people who spend a lot of time commuting — whether that be by car, train, or otherwise — audiobooks are a lifeline. Audible allows you to gift Premium Plus memberships, which provides access to thousands of audiobooks and podcasts in an "all-you-can-listen" format. You can even control when Audible will "deliver" the gift via email. Concert tickets Best experiential gift Snag some tickets to see a band they love and then think up a little riddle so they have to guess who you're going to see. If clever wordplay isn't your thing, then lead them on a treasure hunt throughout the house with various song titles as clues until they discover the tickets in the final spot. Sometimes the best gifts come down to how you wrap them. Chocolate covered strawberries Best for a sweet treat Another classic Valentine's Day gift, chocolate-covered strawberries are a delicious way to show someone you love them. Maybe that special someone will share — if you're lucky. Shari's Berries also offers same-day delivery in some areas. Tile Bluetooth trackers Best if they're always losing their keys Tile trackers are perfect for anyone who consistently loses their keys or wallet (or the TV remote.) This bundle includes four trackers in varying sizes, so they can keep tabs on multiple objects using the corresponding app. Le Creuset heart cocotte Best for the aesthetic cook Le Creuset is known for its enamelware, and this heart-shaped cocotte will look adorable in any kitchen. It can be used on the stove or in the oven, and will make the perfect vessel for a romantic Valentine's Day meal. A small and discreet vibrator Best for same-day delivery For something spicy, choose from a selection of vibrators at Sephora, which offers same-day delivery. The lipstick-sized device featured here is waterproof, rechargeable, and designed especially for people with a clitoris. Get free delivery through Valentine's Day with the code LOVEFREESDD. Just make sure to place your order by 1pm PT. Amazon gift card Best for choosing their own gift Maybe your significant other already has a Prime account. Perfect! Get them an Amazon gift card so they can put that free shipping to use. Card amounts start at $25. Spafinder gift card Best for a day of relaxation A back rub from someone you love is super sweet, but a massage from a professional is unbeatable. Spafinder is a catch-all spa gift card with partners all over the country, so your sweetheart will be able to find a location in their area. HelloFresh subscription Best for the foodie Take the effort out of meal planning for your sweetheart. HelloFresh delivers meal ingredients on a weekly basis, so your S.O. will get to enjoy cooking without having to plan recipes and buy ingredients. A bouquet of flowers Best classic Valentine's Day gift Flowers are a staple in Valentine's Day gift giving, and you don't have to plan in advance to get a beautiful, professional-looking bouquet. The Bouqs Co. offers same-day delivery in some areas. A subscription box Best gift that keeps giving It's totally fine if the first subscription box doesn't show up exactly on Valentine's Day, so they're a great option if you're a little late to order your gift. Cratejoy has plenty, from escape room boxes to boxes for plant lovers. Online course Best for learning something new Is there a skill your loved one has been wanting to learn? Gift them an online course from Udemy. There are more than 100,000 courses offered, so you'll surely be able to find one they'd like. White noise machine Best for a good night's sleep If your Valentine struggles to fall asleep at night — or just hates silence — a 'LectroFan noise machine is the answer. It has 10 fan sounds and white, pink, and brown noise options, helping to lull them off to dreamland each night all thanks to you. Downloadable print Best for the decorator For wall art that you can gift immediately, purchase a downloadable file from Etsy. Then print it at a CVS or Walgreens for quick pick-up, and snag a nice frame while you're at it. Hydro Flask water bottle Best for the environmentally conscious Your boo needs to stay hydrated, so they might as well do it in style and help the Earth, too. Hydro Flask bottles keep liquids cold for 24 hours and hot for 12. Everyone should have a reusable water bottle. Cozy weighted blanket Best for snuggling up Weighted blankets have rocketed into popularity, but some of them aren't really that comfortable. This sherpa one is super velvety and soft, so you can make sure your S.O. is as cozy as possible. Disney+ subscription Best for Disney fans If your significant other stopped watching Disney+ after their free trial ended, gift them a subscription to the service. You can select a delivery date and Disney will email the gift with instructions on how to redeem. Bath tub tray Best for a self care moment If your partner loves to take baths, they need a bath tray. This one has spots for a book/laptop/tablet, phone, candle, wine glass, standard glass, and miscellaneous items like bubble bath. It's expandable to fit almost any tub. MasterClass Best for the lifelong learner If your significant other is always picking up new hobbies, or has a thirst for knowledge, a MasterClass membership will help them conquer some new skills. From cooking with Michelin star chefs to perfecting your tennis backhand with pro athletes, there are classes offered for pretty much every interest, taught by certified experts. A coffee club subscription Best for coffee drinkers This travel-themed coffee subscription delivers a box of java from around the globe each month, alongside some info about the origins of the coffee. Atlas Coffee Club allows you to select from grounds, whole beans, or even pods that are compatible with Keurig or Nespresso, and you can also narrow down by roast type.

A KindleUnlimited Plan

Best when paired with a Kindle

For some people, a neverending TBR pile is a point of pride. Gift them thousands of titles at their fingertips with a membership to KindleUnlimited, which can be accessed via the Kindle app on any of the compatible e-readers. (Which is all of them.) Once you sign them up, a code will be sent to your Valentine on the day of your choosing.

Sur la Table online cooking classes

Best for a cozy date night

A cooking class is such a sweet date idea, but it can be challenging to get out of the house (especially if you have kids). Sur la table's online cooking classes solve this problem. Choose from classics like fresh pasta and beef bourguignon or stretch your skills with sushi, macarons, or a two-day croissant workshop. Classes start at $29 per session, regardless of how many people are in your kitchen.

An Audible membership

Best for good listeners

For people who spend a lot of time commuting — whether that be by car, train, or otherwise — audiobooks are a lifeline. Audible allows you to gift Premium Plus memberships, which provides access to thousands of audiobooks and podcasts in an "all-you-can-listen" format. You can even control when Audible will "deliver" the gift via email.

Concert tickets

Best experiential gift

Snag some tickets to see a band they love and then think up a little riddle so they have to guess who you're going to see. If clever wordplay isn't your thing, then lead them on a treasure hunt throughout the house with various song titles as clues until they discover the tickets in the final spot. Sometimes the best gifts come down to how you wrap them.

Chocolate covered strawberries

Best for a sweet treat

Another classic Valentine's Day gift, chocolate-covered strawberries are a delicious way to show someone you love them. Maybe that special someone will share — if you're lucky. Shari's Berries also offers same-day delivery in some areas.

Tile Bluetooth trackers

Best if they're always losing their keys

Tile trackers are perfect for anyone who consistently loses their keys or wallet (or the TV remote.) This bundle includes four trackers in varying sizes, so they can keep tabs on multiple objects using the corresponding app.

Le Creuset heart cocotte

Best for the aesthetic cook

Le Creuset is known for its enamelware, and this heart-shaped cocotte will look adorable in any kitchen. It can be used on the stove or in the oven, and will make the perfect vessel for a romantic Valentine's Day meal.

A small and discreet vibrator

Best for same-day delivery

For something spicy, choose from a selection of vibrators at Sephora, which offers same-day delivery. The lipstick-sized device featured here is waterproof, rechargeable, and designed especially for people with a clitoris. Get free delivery through Valentine's Day with the code LOVEFREESDD. Just make sure to place your order by 1pm PT.

Amazon gift card

Best for choosing their own gift

Maybe your significant other already has a Prime account. Perfect! Get them an Amazon gift card so they can put that free shipping to use. Card amounts start at $25.

Spafinder gift card

Best for a day of relaxation

A back rub from someone you love is super sweet, but a massage from a professional is unbeatable. Spafinder is a catch-all spa gift card with partners all over the country, so your sweetheart will be able to find a location in their area.

HelloFresh subscription

Best for the foodie

Take the effort out of meal planning for your sweetheart. HelloFresh delivers meal ingredients on a weekly basis, so your S.O. will get to enjoy cooking without having to plan recipes and buy ingredients.

A bouquet of flowers

Best classic Valentine's Day gift

Flowers are a staple in Valentine's Day gift giving, and you don't have to plan in advance to get a beautiful, professional-looking bouquet. The Bouqs Co. offers same-day delivery in some areas.

A subscription box

Best gift that keeps giving

It's totally fine if the first subscription box doesn't show up exactly on Valentine's Day, so they're a great option if you're a little late to order your gift. Cratejoy has plenty, from escape room boxes to boxes for plant lovers.

Online course

Best for learning something new

Is there a skill your loved one has been wanting to learn? Gift them an online course from Udemy. There are more than 100,000 courses offered, so you'll surely be able to find one they'd like.

White noise machine

Best for a good night's sleep

If your Valentine struggles to fall asleep at night — or just hates silence — a 'LectroFan noise machine is the answer. It has 10 fan sounds and white, pink, and brown noise options, helping to lull them off to dreamland each night all thanks to you.

Downloadable print

Best for the decorator

For wall art that you can gift immediately, purchase a downloadable file from Etsy. Then print it at a CVS or Walgreens for quick pick-up, and snag a nice frame while you're at it.

Hydro Flask water bottle

Best for the environmentally conscious

Your boo needs to stay hydrated, so they might as well do it in style and help the Earth, too. Hydro Flask bottles keep liquids cold for 24 hours and hot for 12. Everyone should have a reusable water bottle.

Cozy weighted blanket

Best for snuggling up

Weighted blankets have rocketed into popularity, but some of them aren't really that comfortable. This sherpa one is super velvety and soft, so you can make sure your S.O. is as cozy as possible.

Disney+ subscription

Best for Disney fans

If your significant other stopped watching Disney+ after their free trial ended, gift them a subscription to the service. You can select a delivery date and Disney will email the gift with instructions on how to redeem.

Bath tub tray

Best for a self care moment

If your partner loves to take baths, they need a bath tray. This one has spots for a book/laptop/tablet, phone, candle, wine glass, standard glass, and miscellaneous items like bubble bath. It's expandable to fit almost any tub.

MasterClass

Best for the lifelong learner

If your significant other is always picking up new hobbies, or has a thirst for knowledge, a MasterClass membership will help them conquer some new skills. From cooking with Michelin star chefs to perfecting your tennis backhand with pro athletes, there are classes offered for pretty much every interest, taught by certified experts.

A coffee club subscription

Best for coffee drinkers

This travel-themed coffee subscription delivers a box of java from around the globe each month, alongside some info about the origins of the coffee. Atlas Coffee Club allows you to select from grounds, whole beans, or even pods that are compatible with Keurig or Nespresso, and you can also narrow down by roast type.
